alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 11:33PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central, and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, City of Williamsburg, James City, Surry and York. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. during the next 1 to 2 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Charles City, Claremont, Surry, Toano, Norge, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Gloucester Point, Rustic, Holdcroft, Jamestown, Scotland, Barhamsville, Kings Point, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Ruthville and Busch Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry
